alert.note: Alert for Colorado (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 5:49PM CST until January 29 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Colorado. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cummins Creek, Bee Branch, Plum Branch, Bull Creek, Zimmer Creek, Boggy Creek and Piper Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern Colorado County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
